body:
I think one way to let developer not have to pass in an empty property map is to give one- and two-arity signatures to the components.

```
(defn breadcrumbs-list
  ([& children]
   (into [:ol (use-style breadcrumbs-list-style) children]))
  ([{:keys [style]} & children]
   (into [:ol (use-style (merge breadcrumbs-list-style style)) children])))
```

A pattern I often see with these kinds of simple lists, is to pass in the list data to the main parent component. It might look like:

```
(def data ["Lorem" "Ipsum" "Athens"])
(defn component
  []
  [breadcrumbs-list (use-style {:color "blue"} {:data data})])
```

`breadcrumbs-list` is then in charge of iterating over the loop, and the API is simplified in a way. I'm not saying we should necessarily do this, just thinking about API design
